title: Portrait Photo of President Truman, Seated in Chair
Scopenote: Very nice color portrait photograph of President Harry S. Truman seated in a chair with books in front of him, half figure.

title: Truman with Eddie Jacobson, Kansas City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) with Eddie Jacobson (right) on the southeast corner of Linwood Boulevard and Flora Avenue in Kansas City, Missouri.  The building on the left is part of the west wall of B'nai Jehudah Temple.  This photo was taken outside the temple after religious school students presented former President Truman with a certificate for trees planted in his honor in Israel.  Mr. Jacobson was then a trustee of Congregation B'nai Jehudah.  Mr. Truman has autographed the photo. The young lady on the left is Irene Stiefel, later Irene Stiefel Starr.  From: Frank Adler.

title: Portrait of H. Freeman Matthews
Scopenote: H. Freeman Matthews, career in the U.S. Department of State, 1923-62. Director, Office of European Affairs, U.S. Department of State, 1944-47; accompanied President Franklin D. Roosevelt to the Yalta Conference, 1945; served as a political adviser at the Potsdam Conference, 1945, meeting of Foreign Ministers in Moscow (1945), Paris (1946), New York (1946), Moscow (1947), and at the Paris Peace Conference (1946); Ambassador to Sweden, 1947-50, Deputy Under Secretary of State, 1950-53; and later ambassadorial posts.

title: Portrait of John P. Young
Scopenote: Portrait of John P. Young that was used in conjunction with his oral history interview.  Mr. Young was Chief, Division of International Finance, Department of State, 1943-1965.

title: Truman home after snow
Scopenote: Exterior of the home of President and Mrs. Harry S. Truman after a snowstorm.
